pr_title: Implemented SingleValue Scrutinizer tests using mocks

timeline.bodyText: I think all exceptions can accept constraints, so how about we pull the parsing code in this class to a common superclass of all the inner classes you have been introducing?
timeline.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText: Sure, we can make a constraint class that will be extended by these inner classes. And check what all parameters can be added over there other than exceptions that are generally common to all property constraints.
replies.author: darecoder

replies.bodyText: Great! Constraint status is another one.
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText: You should not need to declare a new field for constraint exceptions again: you can just reuse the one from the super class. So, for all constraints which do not take any parameters, you should not need to declare any inner class: the Constraint class itself can be used in the scrutinizer.
timeline.author: wetneb

timeline.message:
Implemented SingleValue Scrutinizer tests using mocks

Updated test class & added inner class to the scrutinizer
